verses.kjv: Hezekiah began to reign when he was five and twenty years old, and he reigned nine and twenty years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
verses.web: Hezekiah began to reign when he was twenty-five years old, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
verses.ct: Hezekiah became king at the age of 25, and he reigned in Jerusalem for 29 years. His mother was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that David his father had done.
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, according to all that David his father had done.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he did what was right, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.kjv: He in the first year of his reign, in the first month, opened the doors of the house of the LORD, and repaired them.
verses.web: In the first year of his reign, in the first month, he opened the doors of LORD’s house, and repaired them.
verses.ct: In the very first month of his first year as king, he reopened the doors of the LORD's temple and had them repaired.

verses.kjv: And he brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the east street,
verses.web: He brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the wide place on the east,
verses.ct: He assembled the priests and the Levites in the open square on the east side of the temple

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Hear me, ye Levites, sanctify now yourselves, and sanctify the house of the LORD God of your fathers, and carry forth the filthiness out of the holy place.
verses.web: and said to them, “Listen to me, you Levites! Now sanctify yourselves, and sanctify LORD, the God of your fathers’ house, and carry the filthiness out of the holy place.
verses.ct: and said to them, "Listen to me, Levites! Consecrate yourselves and consecrate the house of the LORD, the God of your ancestors. Remove everything unclean from the holy place.

verses.kjv: For our fathers have trespassed, and done that which was evil in the eyes of the LORD our God, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of the LORD, and turned their backs.
verses.web: For our fathers were unfaithful, and have done that which was evil in LORD our God’s sight, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of LORD, and turned their backs.
verses.ct: Our ancestors were unfaithful and did what the LORD our God saw as evil. They abandoned him, turned their faces away from his dwelling place, and turned their backs on him.

verses.kjv: Also they have shut up the doors of the porch, and put out the lamps, and have not burned incense nor offered burnt offerings in the holy place unto the God of Israel.
verses.web: Also they have shut up the doors of the porch, and put out the lamps, and have not burned incense nor offered burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.
verses.ct: They even shut the doors of the temple porch, snuffed out the lamps, and stopped burning incense and offering burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the wrath of the LORD was upon Judah and Jerusalem, and he hath delivered them to trouble, to astonishment, and to hissing, as ye see with your eyes.
verses.web: Therefore LORD’s wrath was on Judah and Jerusalem, and he has delivered them to be tossed back and forth, to be an astonishment, and a hissing, as you see with your eyes.
verses.ct: Because of this, the LORD's wrath fell on Judah and Jerusalem. He made them an object of horror, shock, and mockery — you've seen it with your own eyes.

verses.kjv: For, lo, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.
verses.web: For, behold, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.
verses.ct: Our fathers have been killed by the sword, and our sons, daughters, and wives have been taken captive because of all this.

verses.kjv: Now it is in mine heart to make a covenant with the LORD God of Israel, that his fierce wrath may turn away from us.
verses.web: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with LORD, the God of Israel, that his fierce anger may turn away from us.
verses.ct: Now I intend to make a covenant with the LORD, the God of Israel, so that his fierce anger will turn away from us.

verses.kjv: My sons, be not now negligent: for the LORD hath chosen you to stand before him, to serve him, and that ye should minister unto him, and burn incense.
verses.web: My sons, don’t be negligent now; for LORD has chosen you to stand before him, to minister to him, and that you should be his ministers, and burn incense.”
verses.ct: My sons, don't be careless about this. The LORD has chosen you to stand in his presence, to serve him, to minister before him, and to burn incense."

verses.kjv: Then the Levites arose, Mahath the son of Amasai, and Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites: and of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi, and Azariah the son of Jehalelel: and of the Gershonites; Joah the son of Zimmah, and Eden the son of Joah:
verses.web: Then the Levites arose, Mahath, the son of Amasai, and Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites; and of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi, and Azariah the son of Jehallelel; and of the Gershonites, Joah the son of Zimmah, and Eden the son of Joah;
verses.ct: Then the Levites got to work. From the Kohathites: Mahath son of Amasai and Joel son of Azariah. From the descendants of Merari: Kish son of Abdi and Azariah son of Jehalelel. From the Gershonites: Joah son of Zimmah and Eden son of Joah.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Elizaphan; Shimri, and Jeiel: and of the sons of Asaph; Zechariah, and Mattaniah:
verses.web: and of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeuel; and of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;
verses.ct: From the descendants of Elizaphan: Shimri and Jeiel. From the descendants of Asaph: Zechariah and Mattaniah.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Heman; Jehiel, and Shimei: and of the sons of Jeduthun; Shemaiah, and Uzziel.
verses.web: and of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Heman: Jehiel and Shimei. From the descendants of Jeduthun: Shemaiah and Uzziel.

verses.kjv: And they gathered their brethren, and sanctified themselves, and came, according to the commandment of the king, by the words of the LORD, to cleanse the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They gathered their brothers, sanctified themselves, and went in, according to the commandment of the king by LORD’s words, to cleanse LORD’s house.
verses.ct: They gathered their fellow Levites, consecrated themselves, and entered the temple to cleanse the LORD's house, just as the king had commanded based on the word of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priests went into the inner part of the house of the LORD, to cleanse it, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of the LORD into the court of the house of the LORD. And the Levites took it, to carry it out abroad into the brook Kidron.
verses.web: The priests went into the inner part of LORD’s house to cleanse it, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in LORD’s temple into the court of LORD’s house. The Levites took it from there to carry it out to the brook Kidron.
verses.ct: The priests went into the innermost part of the LORD's temple to purify it. They carried out every unclean thing they found into the courtyard of the temple, and the Levites hauled it all away to the Kidron Valley.

verses.kjv: Now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify, and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of the LORD: so they sanctified the house of the LORD in eight days; and in the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.
verses.web: Now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify, and on the eighth day of the month they came to LORD’s porch. They sanctified LORD’s house in eight days, and on the sixteenth day of the first month they finished.
verses.ct: They started the consecration on the 1st day of the 1st month. By the 8th day they had reached the temple porch. They spent another 8 days consecrating the LORD's house itself, finishing on the 16th day of the 1st month.

verses.kjv: Then they went in to Hezekiah the king, and said, We have cleansed all the house of the LORD, and the altar of burnt offering, with all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread table, with all the vessels thereof.
verses.web: Then they went in to Hezekiah the king within the palace, and said, “We have cleansed all LORD’s house, including the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels, and the table of show bread with all its vessels.
verses.ct: Then they went to King Hezekiah and reported, "We have cleansed the entire house of the LORD — the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the table for the bread of the Presence and all its utensils.

verses.kjv: Moreover all the vessels, which king Ahaz in his reign did cast away in his transgression, have we prepared and sanctified, and, behold, they are before the altar of the LORD.
verses.web: Moreover have we prepared and sanctified all the vessels which king Ahaz threw away in his reign, when he was unfaithful. Behold, they are before LORD’s altar.”
verses.ct: We have also restored and consecrated all the vessels that King Ahaz discarded during his unfaithful reign. They are now in place before the LORD's altar."

verses.kjv: Then Hezekiah the king rose early, and gathered the rulers of the city, and went up to the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Then Hezekiah the king arose early, gathered the princes of the city, and went up to LORD’s house.
verses.ct: King Hezekiah got up early the next morning, gathered the city's leaders, and went up to the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And they brought seven bullocks, and seven rams, and seven lambs, and seven he goats, for a sin offering for the kingdom, and for the sanctuary, and for Judah. And he commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on the altar of the LORD.
verses.web: They brought seven bulls, seven rams, seven lambs, and seven male goats, for a sin offering for the kingdom, for the sanctuary, and for Judah. He commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on LORD’s altar.
verses.ct: They brought 7 bulls, 7 rams, 7 lambs, and 7 male goats as a sin offering for the kingdom, for the sanctuary, and for Judah. Hezekiah ordered the priests — the descendants of Aaron — to offer them on the LORD's altar.

verses.kjv: So they killed the bullocks, and the priests received the blood, and sprinkled it on the altar: likewise, when they had killed the rams, they sprinkled the blood upon the altar: they killed also the lambs, and they sprinkled the blood upon the altar.
verses.web: So they killed the bulls, and the priests received the blood, and sprinkled it on the altar. They killed the rams, and sprinkled the blood on the altar. They also killed the lambs, and sprinkled the blood on the altar.
verses.ct: The priests slaughtered the bulls, caught the blood, and sprinkled it on the altar. Then they slaughtered the rams and sprinkled their blood on the altar. They did the same with the lambs.

verses.kjv: And they brought forth the he goats for the sin offering before the king and the congregation; and they laid their hands upon them:
verses.web: They brought near the male goats for the sin offering before the king and the assembly; and they laid their hands on them.
verses.ct: Next, the male goats for the sin offering were brought before the king and the assembly, and they laid their hands on them.

verses.kjv: And the priests killed them, and they made reconciliation with their blood upon the altar, to make an atonement for all Israel: for the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering should be made for all Israel.
verses.web: Then the priests killed them, and they made a sin offering with their blood on the altar, to make atonement for all Israel; for the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering should be made for all Israel.
verses.ct: The priests slaughtered the goats and poured their blood on the altar as a sin offering to make atonement for all Israel, because the king had ordered that the burnt offering and the sin offering be made on behalf of all Israel.

verses.kjv: And he set the Levites in the house of the LORD with cymbals, with psalteries, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, and of Gad the king’s seer, and Nathan the prophet: for so was the commandment of the LORD by his prophets.
verses.web: He set the Levites in LORD’s house with cymbals, with stringed instruments, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, of Gad the king’s seer, and Nathan the prophet; for the commandment was from LORD by his prophets.
verses.ct: Hezekiah stationed the Levites in the LORD's temple with cymbals, harps, and lyres, following the instructions that David, Gad the king's seer, and Nathan the prophet had given — for this command had come from the LORD through his prophets.

verses.kjv: And the Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.
verses.web: The Levites stood with David’s instruments, and the priests with the trumpets.
verses.ct: The Levites stood ready with the instruments David had provided, and the priests stood with their trumpets.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah commanded to offer the burnt offering upon the altar. And when the burnt offering began, the song of the LORD began also with the trumpets, and with the instruments ordained by David king of Israel.
verses.web: Hezekiah commanded them to offer the burnt offering on the altar. When the burnt offering began, LORD’s song also began, along with the trumpets and David king of Israel’s instruments.
verses.ct: Hezekiah gave the order to offer the burnt offering on the altar. The moment the burnt offering began, singing to the LORD also began, accompanied by trumpets and the instruments of King David of Israel.

verses.kjv: And all the congregation worshipped, and the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded: and all this continued until the burnt offering was finished.
verses.web: All the assembly worshiped, the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded. All this continued until the burnt offering was finished.
verses.ct: The whole assembly worshiped, the singers sang, and the trumpeters played. All of this continued until the burnt offering was complete.

verses.kjv: And when they had made an end of offering, the king and all that were present with him bowed themselves, and worshipped.
verses.web: When they had finished offering, the king and all who were present with him bowed themselves and worshiped.
verses.ct: When the offerings were finished, the king and everyone with him knelt down and worshiped.

verses.kjv: Moreover Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praise unto the LORD with the words of David, and of Asaph the seer. And they sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshipped.
verses.web: Moreover Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praises to LORD with the words of David, and of Asaph the seer. They sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshiped.
verses.ct: Then King Hezekiah and the officials told the Levites to sing praises to the LORD using the psalms of David and Asaph the seer. They sang with great joy, then bowed their heads and worshiped.

verses.kjv: Then Hezekiah answered and said, Now ye have consecrated yourselves unto the LORD, come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of the LORD. And the congregation brought in sacrifices and thank offerings; and as many as were of a free heart burnt offerings.
verses.web: Then Hezekiah answered, “Now you have consecrated yourselves to LORD. Come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into LORD’s house.” The assembly brought in sacrifices and thank offerings, and as many as were of a willing heart brought burnt offerings.
verses.ct: Hezekiah then said, "You have now consecrated yourselves to the LORD. Come forward and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the LORD's house." So the assembly brought sacrifices and thank offerings, and everyone who was willing also brought burnt offerings.

verses.kjv: And the number of the burnt offerings, which the congregation brought, was threescore and ten bullocks, an hundred rams, and two hundred lambs: all these were for a burnt offering to the LORD.
verses.web: The number of the burnt offerings which the assembly brought was seventy bulls, one hundred rams, and two hundred lambs. All these were for a burnt offering to LORD.
verses.ct: The total number of burnt offerings the assembly brought was 70 bulls, 100 rams, and 200 lambs — all of these as burnt offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the consecrated things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.
verses.web: The consecrated things were six hundred head of cattle and three thousand sheep.
verses.ct: The consecrated offerings totaled 600 cattle and 3,000 sheep.

verses.kjv: But the priests were too few, so that they could not flay all the burnt offerings: wherefore their brethren the Levites did help them, till the work was ended, and until the other priests had sanctified themselves: for the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.
verses.web: But the priests were too few, so that they could not skin all the burnt offerings. Therefore their brothers the Levites helped them, until the work was ended, and until the priests had sanctified themselves; for the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.
verses.ct: But there weren't enough priests to skin all the burnt offerings, so their fellow Levites stepped in to help until the work was done and more priests had consecrated themselves. The Levites had been more diligent about consecrating themselves than the priests had been.

verses.kjv: And also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings, and the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of the house of the LORD was set in order.
verses.web: Also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings, and with the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of LORD’s house was set in order.
verses.ct: On top of the large number of burnt offerings, there was also the fat from the peace offerings and the drink offerings that accompanied each burnt offering. And so the worship at the LORD's temple was fully restored.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah rejoiced, and all the people, that God had prepared the people: for the thing was done suddenly.
verses.web: Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced, because of that which God had prepared for the people; for the thing was done suddenly.
verses.ct: Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced over what God had made possible for them, because it had all come together so quickly.
